lessons.title: Example: Grid area property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the property used to give grid items a name.

Make sure to type grid-area.

lessons.title: Example: Grid template value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the missing area name.

Make sure to type item-c.

lessons.title: Question: Grid template
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid rows do we create using this code?

OneTwoThree

Make sure to pick One.

lessons.title: Example: Empty
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a grid row where the first area is empty.

Make sure to pick ..

lessons.title: Example: Multiple Grid Rows
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the grid rows so that the second row has two grid items.

Make sure to pick "item-b item-c".

lessons.title: Example: Sections
lessons.interactiveContent:
To create web sections, add the classes header, sidebar, main and footer to the grid container child elements.

Make sure to pick header followed by sidebar and then main, footer.

lessons.title: Example: Grid names
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the header and sidebar values to the correct properties and rules.

Make sure to pick grid-area followed by header and then grid-area, sidebar.

lessons.title: Example: Header
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the grid-template-areas value so that the header section spans across three columns.

Make sure to type header header header.

lessons.title: Example: Sidebar
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the grid so that it contains a sidebar that spans across one column on the right side main content.

Make sure to pick main, followed by main, and finally sidebar.

lessons.title: Example: Content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the main content span across all three columns.

Make sure to pick " followed by main and then main, main, ".

lessons.title: Example: Row - end
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use justify-items to align grid items to their right edge of the grid area.

Make sure to pick end.

lessons.title: Question: Row axis - center
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property does the grid have?

justify-items: center;justify-items: middle;justify-items: stretch;

justify-items: center;.

lessons.title: Example: Column - stretch
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the grid items to occupy the entire grid area along the column axis.

Make sure to pick align-items, followed by stretch.

lessons.title: Question: Column axis - start and end
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property does the grid have?

align-items: end;justify-items: end;align-items: stretch;

align-items: end;.

lessons.title: Example: Column - center
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the value that aligns grid items to the center of the grid column axis.

Make sure to type center.

lessons.title: Question: CSS Grid
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which layout is ideal for creating a webpage in two dimensions?

Grid layoutFlex layoutBlock layout

Grid layout.

lessons.title: Question: Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which layout is ideal for aligning the contents of a webpage section?

Flexbox layoutGrid layoutBlock layout

Flexbox layout.

lessons.title: Example: Combining CSS Grid and Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the classes so that the second grid item becomes a flex container.

Make sure to pick grid-container, followed by article.

lessons.title: Example: CSS Grid - structure
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the ideal property and value to define the structure of the webpage so that there are three rows and one column.

Make sure to pick grid-template followed by repeat and then (, 3,, 1fr, ), 1fr.

lessons.title: Example: Flexbox - content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the article class display as a column and center the flex items inside the container.

Make sure to pick column, followed by center, and finally center.
